title: List of worms and gastropods
data:
***Version [0.28](/0.28 "0.28")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

*Crawl*'s **worms and gastropods** are an assortment of enemies whose defining traits are moderately powerful attacks and mindless hunger. That said, they are generally quite slow and often have virtually no defenses to speak of, so most characters will not find them terribly difficult to handle. Much like *Crawl*'s [arthropods](/List_of_arthropods "List of arthropods"), they are largely weak to [poison](/Poison "Poison") and lack endoskeletons, meaning they cannot be raised as [skeletons](/Skeleton "Skeleton").

Most of them have been removed over time, as they presented few challenges to competent players. Those that remain are known for having dangerous abilities that compensate for their slow speed.

## Contents

- [1 Worm types](#Worm_types)
- [2 Gastropod types](#Gastropod_types)
  - [2.1 Unique gastropod](#Unique_gastropod)
- [3 Retired worms and gastropods](#Retired_worms_and_gastropods)
- [4 History](#History)

## Worm types

w [![Worm.png](/images/5/52/Worm.png)](/File:Worm.png) **[Worm](/Worm "Worm")** - These enormous pests can mangle inexperienced adventurers. They recover swiftly from injuries.

w [![Steelbarb worm.png](/images/c/c5/Steelbarb_worm.png)](/File:Steelbarb_worm.png) **[Steelbarb worm](/Steelbarb_worm "Steelbarb worm")** - Fast, armored worms whose bites leave painful [barbs](/Barbs "Barbs") in their prey.

w [![Swamp worm.png](/images/d/df/Swamp_worm.png)](/File:Swamp_worm.png) **[Swamp worm](/Swamp_worm "Swamp worm")** - Exceptionally swift worms with painful bites that can [pull passersby](/Harpoon_Shot "Harpoon Shot") into the murk of [the Swamp](/The_Swamp "The Swamp").

w [![Tyrant leech.png](/images/b/be/Tyrant_leech.png)](/File:Tyrant_leech.png) **[Tyrant leech](/Tyrant_leech "Tyrant leech")** - Loathsome swamp-dwellers that gorge themselves on blood as they tear prey limb from limb.

## Gastropod types

w [![Dart slug.png](/images/c/c2/Dart_slug.png)](/File:Dart_slug.png) **[Dart slug](/Dart_slug "Dart slug")** - A small slug that can launch [chitinous darts](/Slug_Dart "Slug Dart") with remarkable range & power.

w [![Torpor snail.png](/images/a/a5/Torpor_snail.png)](/File:Torpor_snail.png) **[Torpor snail](/Torpor_snail "Torpor snail")** - An enormous snail sacred to [Cheibriados](/Cheibriados "Cheibriados") whose very presence [slows](/Slow "Slow") its prey.

### Unique gastropod

w [![Gastronok.png](/images/6/63/Gastronok.png)](/File:Gastronok.png) **[Gastronok](/Gastronok "Gastronok")** - A particularly massive and powerful slug wearing a fancy [hat](/Hat "Hat"). He's slow, but he has various spells to get around that.

## Retired worms and gastropods

w [![Brain worm.png](/images/a/a6/Brain_worm.png)](/File:Brain_worm.png) **[Brain worm](/Brain_worm "Brain worm")** - Unnatural creatures that fed on the minds of sentient beings.

w [![Lava worm.png](/images/8/85/Lava_worm.png)](/File:Lava_worm.png) **[Lava worm](/Lava_worm "Lava worm")** - Easily avoidable lava-dwelling annelids with fiery bites.

j [![Giant slug.png](/images/e/e2/Giant_slug.png)](/File:Giant_slug.png) **[Giant slug](/Giant_slug "Giant slug")** - Beefy and fairly strong, but extremely slow and with no defense to speak of.

j [![Elephant slug.png](/images/2/22/Elephant_slug.png)](/File:Elephant_slug.png) **[Elephant slug](/Elephant_slug "Elephant slug")** - A slug the size of an elephant. Basically just an even bigger giant slug.

w [![Rock worm.png](/images/2/23/Rock_worm.png)](/File:Rock_worm.png) **[Rock worm](/Rock_worm "Rock worm")** - Cautious predators which could swim through rock and stone as though it were water.

w [![Spiny worm.png](/images/8/84/Spiny_worm.png)](/File:Spiny_worm.png) **[Spiny worm](/Spiny_worm "Spiny worm")** - Aggravating [acidic](/Acid "Acid") worms that corroded your equipment with toxic stings.

j [![Agate snail.png](/images/8/8a/Agate_snail.png)](/File:Agate_snail.png) **[Agate snail](/Agate_snail "Agate snail")** - A variety of snail that would withdraw into its shell when injured, gaining extra defense and regeneration.

## History

- [0.28](/0.28 "0.28") added steelbarb worms.
- In [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"), brain worms were removed and dart slugs were added.
- In [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), lava worms, giant slugs, and elephant slugs were removed while torpor snails were added. Additionally, gastropods had their glyph changed from 'j' to 'w', lumping them in with worms.
- In [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), rock worms, spiny worms, and agate snails were removed.
html:
List of worms and gastropods

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.28: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

Crawl's worms and gastropods are an assortment of enemies whose defining traits are moderately powerful attacks and mindless hunger. That said, they are generally quite slow and often have virtually no defenses to speak of, so most characters will not find them terribly difficult to handle. Much like Crawl's arthropods, they are largely weak to poison and lack endoskeletons, meaning they cannot be raised as skeletons.

Most of them have been removed over time, as they presented few challenges to competent players. Those that remain are known for having dangerous abilities that compensate for their slow speed.

Contents

  • 1 Worm types
  • 2 Gastropod types
    • 2.1 Unique gastropod
  • 3 Retired worms and gastropods
  • 4 History

Worm types

w Worm - These enormous pests can mangle inexperienced adventurers. They recover swiftly from injuries.

w Steelbarb worm - Fast, armored worms whose bites leave painful barbs in their prey.

w Swamp worm - Exceptionally swift worms with painful bites that can pull passersby into the murk of the Swamp.

w Tyrant leech - Loathsome swamp-dwellers that gorge themselves on blood as they tear prey limb from limb.

Gastropod types

w Dart slug - A small slug that can launch chitinous darts with remarkable range & power.

w Torpor snail - An enormous snail sacred to Cheibriados whose very presence slows its prey.

Unique gastropod

w Gastronok - A particularly massive and powerful slug wearing a fancy hat. He's slow, but he has various spells to get around that.

Retired worms and gastropods

w Brain worm - Unnatural creatures that fed on the minds of sentient beings.

w Lava worm - Easily avoidable lava-dwelling annelids with fiery bites.

j Giant slug - Beefy and fairly strong, but extremely slow and with no defense to speak of.

j Elephant slug - A slug the size of an elephant. Basically just an even bigger giant slug.

w Rock worm - Cautious predators which could swim through rock and stone as though it were water.

w Spiny worm - Aggravating acidic worms that corroded your equipment with toxic stings.

j Agate snail - A variety of snail that would withdraw into its shell when injured, gaining extra defense and regeneration.

History

  • 0.28 added steelbarb worms.
  • In 0.18, brain worms were removed and dart slugs were added.
  • In 0.15, lava worms, giant slugs, and elephant slugs were removed while torpor snails were added. Additionally, gastropods had their glyph changed from 'j' to 'w', lumping them in with worms.
  • In 0.14, rock worms, spiny worms, and agate snails were removed.

rawPage:
{{version028}}
''Crawl''<nowiki>'</nowiki>s '''worms and gastropods''' are an assortment of enemies whose defining traits are moderately powerful attacks and mindless hunger. That said, they are generally quite slow and often have virtually no defenses to speak of, so most characters will not find them terribly difficult to handle. Much like ''Crawl''<nowiki>'</nowiki>s [[list of arthropods|arthropods]], they are largely weak to [[poison]] and lack endoskeletons, meaning they cannot be raised as [[skeleton]]s.

Most of them have been removed over time, as they presented few challenges to competent players. Those that remain are known for having dangerous abilities that compensate for their slow speed.

==Worm types==
{{monsterlink|Worm}} - These enormous pests can mangle inexperienced adventurers. They recover swiftly from injuries.

{{monsterlink|Steelbarb worm}} - Fast, armored worms whose bites leave painful [[barbs]] in their prey.

{{monsterlink|Swamp worm}} - Exceptionally swift worms with painful bites that can [[Harpoon Shot|pull passersby]] into the murk of [[the Swamp]].

{{monsterlink|Tyrant leech}} - Loathsome swamp-dwellers that gorge themselves on blood as they tear prey limb from limb.

==Gastropod types==
{{monsterlink|Dart slug}} - A small slug that can launch [[Slug Dart|chitinous darts]] with remarkable range & power.

{{monsterlink|Torpor snail}} - An enormous snail sacred to [[Cheibriados]] whose very presence [[slow]]s its prey.

===Unique gastropod===
{{monsterlink|Gastronok}} - A particularly massive and powerful slug wearing a fancy [[hat]]. He's slow, but he has various spells to get around that.

==Retired worms and gastropods==
{{monsterlink|Brain worm}} - Unnatural creatures that fed on the minds of sentient beings.

{{monsterlink|Lava worm}} - Easily avoidable lava-dwelling annelids with fiery bites.

{{monsterlink|Giant slug}} - Beefy and fairly strong, but extremely slow and with no defense to speak of.

{{monsterlink|Elephant slug}} - A slug the size of an elephant. Basically just an even bigger giant slug.

{{monsterlink|Rock worm}} - Cautious predators which could swim through rock and stone as though it were water.

{{monsterlink|Spiny worm}} - Aggravating [[acid]]ic worms that corroded your equipment with toxic stings.

{{monsterlink|Agate snail}} - A variety of snail that would withdraw into its shell when injured, gaining extra defense and regeneration.

==History==
*[[0.28]] added steelbarb worms.
*In [[0.18]], brain worms were removed and dart slugs were added.
*In [[0.15]], lava worms, giant slugs, and elephant slugs were removed while torpor snails were added. Additionally, gastropods had their glyph changed from 'j' to 'w', lumping them in with worms.
*In [[0.14]], rock worms, spiny worms, and agate snails were removed.
